result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel S Becker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Charges are dismissed and read into 16CF10.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment and that the Defendant be granted Huber Bailee Status.  The State objects to the request for Huber Bailee Status.  The Court adjourns the hearing and denies the request for huber bailee status and bail remains as set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the defendant's non compliance with WCS.  Attorney Schleis requests bail remain as set.  Attorney Behm requests the Court increase cash bail. The Court sets cash bail in the amount of $500.00 cash on each file.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on March 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Gabriel S Becker did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Court addresses the negative WCS report.  The Court issues but stays a capias until next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
